009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Arrays;
014
015//import Fitting.org.doube.geometry.FitCircle;
016import ij.IJ;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021
022/**
023 * Original: Kasa, I., A curve fitting procedure and its error analysis, IEEE Trans. Inst. Meas., 25, 8-14, 1976.
024 * See https://people.cas.uab.edu/~mosya/cl/CircleFitByKasa.cpp (orig code)
025 * http://www.ne.jp/asahi/paleomagnetism.rock-magnetism/basics/pmag/circ/circ1E.html
026 * http://www.ne.jp/asahi/paleomagnetism.rock-magnetism/basics/pmag/circ/circ2E.html
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 *
030 */
031public class CircleFitKasaA extends CircleFitAlgebraic {
032
033        private final double[] q;       // q = (B,C,D) circle parameters
034        
035        public CircleFitKasaA(Pnt2d[] points) {
036                q = fit(points);
037        }
038        
039        @Override
040        public double[] getParameters() {
041                return new double[] {1, q[0], q[1], q[2]};
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * WB's version: Original fails early on shorter arcs, due to numerical problems
046         *         in solving the system of linear equations.
047         * Modified to use (exact) SVD solution on scatter matrix, as described 
048         * in Chernov's book (Eq. 5.5).
049         * This version works with non-centered data!
050         * 
051         * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
052         * 
053         * Circle fit to a given set of data points (in 2D)
054         * 
055         * This is an algebraic fit, disovered and rediscovered by many people. One of
056         * the earliest publications is due to Kasa:
057         * 
058         * I. Kasa, "A curve fitting procedure and its error analysis", IEEE Trans.
059         * Inst. Meas., Vol. 25, pages 8-14, (1976)
060         * 
061         * Input: data - the class of data (contains the given points):
062         * 
063         * data.n - the number of data points data.X[] - the array of X-coordinates
064         * data.Y[] - the array of Y-coordinates
065         * 
066         * Output: circle - parameters of the fitting circle:
067         * 
068         * circle.a - the X-coordinate of the center of the fitting circle circle.b -
069         * the Y-coordinate of the center of the fitting circle circle.r - the radius of
070         * the fitting circle circle.s - the root mean square error (the estimate of
071         * sigma) circle.j - the total number of iterations
072         * 
073         * The method is based on the minimization of the function
074         * 
075         * F = sum [(x-a)^2 + (y-b)^2 - R^2]^2
076         * 
077         * This is perhaps the simplest and fastest circle fit.
078         * 
079         * It works well when data points are sampled along an entire circle or a large
080         * part of it (at least half circle).
081         * 
082         * It does not work well when data points are sampled along a small arc of a
083         * circle. In that case the method is heavily biased, it returns circles that
084         * are too often too small.
085         * 
086         * It is the oldest algebraic circle fit (first published in 1972?). For 20-30
087         * years it has been the most popular circle fit, at least until the more robust
088         * Pratt fit (1987) and Taubin fit (1991) were invented.
089         * 
090         * Nikolai Chernov (September 2012)
091         */
092        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts) {
093                final int n = pts.length;
094                if (n < 3) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
096                }
097
098                // calculate means and elements of scatter matrix
099                double sx = 0, sy = 0, sz = 0;
100                double sxy = 0, sxx = 0, syy = 0, sxz = 0, syz = 0;
101                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
102                        final double x = pts[i].getX();
103                        final double y = pts[i].getY();
104                        final double x2 = sqr(x);
105                        final double y2 = sqr(y);
106                        final double z = x2 + y2;
107                        sx  += x;
108                        sy  += y;
109                        sz  += z;
110                        sxx += x2;
111                        syy += y2;
112                        sxy += x * y;   
113                        sxz += x * z;
114                        syz  += y * z;
115                }
116                
117                double[][] M = {
118                                {sxx, sxy, sx},
119                                {sxy, syy, sy},
120                                { sx,  sy,  n}};
121            
122                double[] b = {-sxz, -syz, -sz};  // RHS vector
123                double[] q = Matrix.solve(M, b); // solve M * q = b (exact), for parameter vector q = (B, C, D)
124                if (q == null) {
125                        IJ.log("KasaA: singular!");
126                        return null;    // no solution
127                }
128                else {
129                        return q;
130                }
131        }
132        
133        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134

422        
423        public static void main(String[] args) {
424                
425                System.out.println("-------------- KASA A (WB) -----------------------------");
426                {
427                        Pnt2d[] pnts = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(PA);
428                        CircleFitKasaA fit = new CircleFitKasaA(pnts);
429                        double[] p = fit.getParameters();
430                        System.out.println("p = " + Arrays.toString(p));
431                        GeometricCircle circle = fit.getGeometricCircle();
432                        System.out.println("circle = " + circle);
433                }
434                
435                
436//              System.out.println("-------------- PRATT (SVD Doube) -----------------------------");

439//                      System.out.println("p = " + Arrays.toString(p));
440//              }
